member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter
member.summary: A wrapper for a TextWriter instance that adds various methods for emitting source code in a nicely formatted way. The formatting conventions can be specified via options.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.#ctor(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: A wrapper for a TextWriter instance that adds various methods for emitting source code in a nicely formatted way. The formatting conventions can be specified via options.
member.param: The TextWriter instance to which the formatted source code is written.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitBlockClosingDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: Write out the given string and note that it is the closing delimiter of a block. If this.IdentBlockContents is true then this.IndentationLevel will be incremented before writing out the delimiter. If this.IndentBlockDelimiters is true then this.IndentationLevel will be decremented after writing out the delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: Write out the given string and note that it is the opening delimiter of a block. If this.IndentBlockDelimiters is true then this.IndentationLevel will be incremented before writing out the delimiter. If this.IdentBlockContents is true then this.IndentationLevel will be incremented after writing out the delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitCaseClosingDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: Write out the given string and note that it is the closing delimiter of a switch case. If this.IndentCaseContents is true then this.IndentationLevel will be decremented before writing out the delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitCaseOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: Write out the given string and note that it is the opening delimiter of a switch case. If this.IndentCaseContents is true then this.IndentationLevel will be incremented after writing out the delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitCatch(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceCatchOnNewLine is true then a new line will be emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitString with the given catch delimiter string.
member.param: A string representing the start of the else part of an if statement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitElse(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceElseOnNewLine is true then a new line will be emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitString with the given else delimiter string.
member.param: A string representing the start of the else part of an if statement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitFinally(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceFinallyOnNewLine is true then a new line will be emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitString with the given finally delimiter string.
member.param: A string representing the start of the else part of an if statement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitLabel(System.String)
member.summary: Emits the given string, after applying the indentation rules applicable to labels.
member.param: The string to emit as a label.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitNewLine
member.summary: Emits a new line character, thus starting a new source line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitString(System.String)
member.summary: Emits the given string to the current source line. If this is the first string on the line, indentation will be emitted before the string. Note, however, that if the string is empty nothing is emitted, not even indentation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitAnonymousMethodBodyOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceAnonymousMethodBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine is true a new line is emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter with the given delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of an anonymous method body block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitAnonymousTypeBodyOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceAnonymousTypeBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine is true a new line is emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter with the given delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a anonymous type body block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitControlBlockOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceControlBlockOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine is true a new line is emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter with the given delimiter. A control block is the body of an loop or the true/false part of an if statement, for example.
member.param: A string representing the start of a control block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitLambdaBodyOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceLambdaBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine is true a new line is emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter with the given delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a lambda body block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitMethodBodyOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceMethodBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine is true a new line is emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter with the given delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a method body block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.EmitTypeBodyOpeningDelimiter(System.String)
member.summary: If this.PlaceTypeBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine is true a new line is emitted, if necessary, before calling this.EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter with the given delimiter.
member.param: A string representing the start of a type body block.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.IndentIfAtStartOfNewLine
member.summary: If nothing has yet been written to the current line, write out this.IndentationLevel*this.IndentSize number of spaces. (Calling this again before first calling EmitNewLine, will have no effect.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.IndentBlockContents
member.summary: If true the indentation level is incremented after the opening delimiter for a block has been emitted and decreased again after the closing delimiter has been emitted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.IndentBlockDelimiters
member.summary: If true then EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter increments the indentation level before writing out the delimiter and EmitBlockClosingDelimiter decrements the indentation level after writing out the delimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.IndentCaseContents
member.summary: If true the indentation level is incremented after the opening delimiter for a switch case has been emitted and decreased again after the closing delimiter has been emitted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.IndentCaseDelimiters
member.summary: If true then EmitCaseOpeningDelimiter increments the indentation level before writing out the delimiter and EmitCaseClosingDelimiter decrements the indentation level after writing out the delimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.LeaveBlankLinesBetweenNamespaceMembers
member.summary: If true, namespace members (for example: types) are separated by blank lines.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.LeaveBlankLinesBetweenTypeMembers
member.summary: If true, type members (for example: fields) are separated by blank lines.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceAnonymousMethodBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitAnonymousMethodBodyOpeningDelimiter starts a new line before calling EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceAnonymousTypeBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitAnonymousTypeBodyOpeningDelimiter starts a new line before calling EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceControlBlockOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitControlBlockOpeningDelimiter starts a new line before calling EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter. A control block is the body of an loop or the true/false part of an if statement, for example.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceCatchOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitCatch starts a new line before emitting the catch delimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceElseOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitElse starts a new line before emitting the else delimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceFinallyOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitFinally starts a new line before emitting the finally delimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceLambdaBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitLambdaBodyOpeningDelimiter starts a new line before calling EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceMethodBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitMethodBodyOpeningDelimiter starts a new line before calling EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceObjectInitializerBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitObjectInitializerBodyOpeningDelimiter starts a new line before calling EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.PlaceTypeBodyOpeningDelimitersOnNewLine
member.summary: If true then EmitTypeBodyOpeningDelimiter starts a new line before calling EmitBlockOpeningDelimiter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.IndentationLevel
member.summary: The number of times this.IndentSize spaces are added to the start of a new line before writing source to it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.IndentSize
member.summary: The number of spaces, for each level of indentation, to add to the start of a new line before writing source code to it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.LabelIndentation
member.summary: The kind of indentation that is to precede a label when it is the first thing on a new line.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.LabelIndentationKind
member.summary: Choices for how labels are to be indented when they start a new line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.LabelIndentationKind.PlaceLabelsInLeftmostColumn
member.summary: Nothing is to precede the label when it is the first thing on a new line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.LabelIndentationKind.PlaceLabelsOneIndentationLessThanCurrentLevel
member.summary: The label is to be indented one level less than the current level of indentation when it is the first thing on a new line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.SourceEmitter.LabelIndentationKind.PlaceLabelsAtCurrentIndentation
member.summary: The label is to be indented at the current level of indentation when it is the first thing on a new line.
